column2: Mario Zammit, 55-64 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take Eltroxin to compensate the side effects of Amiodarone (i.e. hypothyrodism). On two separate occosaions I have suffered hyperthyroidis nothwithstanding monitoring of dosage by my cardiologist.  The first time this happened in June 04 I went into fast AF for four months and no DC cardioversion was successful till i went into hypo.This Christmas the same happened.  In June 09 my TSH was 2.48.  In Dec 09 it shot to <0.05.  I'm very worried I might go through the same experience and have decided to stop Eltroxin temporarily to obtain acceptable Free T4 and TSH levels.

column9: i have been on eltroxin for almost 8yrs. it has been very successful in controlling my symptoms, which included...back pain,dry skin, extreme tiredness, hair loss. ive been taking 150mcg for along time now, but i did start at 250 and have now stabalised at 150. ive never forgotten to take it and always take it at same time each day..before breakfast.

column9: After one month of taking this medication, I feel fine with no side effect so far. But I feel low sex drive, something the physician encouraged me that this condition would disappear by time. I take 50 mcg now and after 3 months my case will be reviewed by the phsician to determine either to increase the dose or continue as it is now.

column2: cindy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm sure may have bad side effects, but one month into this treatment of 100 mcg pr day I have had tremednouse improvement in all areas of my life, this has been a great little pill. Before I had started gaining weight, around 50 lbs within a year with no help of diet or excercise, no energy, dry skin, and depression. Within two weeks of treatment, my stomach started going wayyyyyyyy down, I had my old energy level back and I even have my past perkiness in my eyes and smile and the depression has totally disappeared, I now wake up ready to roll!! I'm up for anything now again and for two years I had no energy then the weight gain and depression, why it took so long to diagnos me with hypothyroid is beyond me but all is well now!
